Package sailpoint.integration

Class JsonUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • sailpoint.integration.JsonUtil
  • public class JsonUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class for rendering and parsing JSON. Dates are rendered as strings, but they do not parse back as dates.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  JsonUtil.JsonParseException
      This internal exception is thrown when this class encounters a parse exception during processing.

    • Field Detail

      • SortMapKeys

        public static boolean SortMapKeys
        A global flag controlling whether we sort map keys before rendering. This is normally false. It is intended for the unit tests that want to compare JSON renderings with previous renderings stored in files. Changes in JVMs can change the interaction order of map entries. In particular 1.5 Hashmap order appears to be random, but in 1.6 the keys come out sorted. By forcing them to render sorted we can use the same test files with different JVMs.

      • DATE_FORMAT

        public static final java.lang.String DATE_FORMAT
        Date format we render.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        Public interface to rendering something as a JSON string. A null value returns a null String, not the JSON string "null".

      • toStringOrJson

        public static java.lang.String toStringOrJson​(java.lang.Object object)
                                       throws java.lang.Exception
        Parses the object and returns a string value or an equivalent JSON representation.

        NOTE: This method is primarily used by the HTTP clients for converting the request body to appropriate json format.

        TODO: Move this method out of here to HttpClientWrapper once other HTTP clients are deprecated.

        Parameters:
        object - object to convert into string or json
        Returns:
        String value, if object is of type string, otherwise json representation
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
